title: This isn't the way to nerf Ahri

body:
I've been avoiding League and LoL-related content recently since I don't want to give myself a stroke, but I have to speak up about this.  

As an Ahri player, I will be one to admit she's strong - a little too strong, but this isn't the nerf you want to look at.  What about that ridiculous movement speed buff she gets from firing off her Q?  Seriously, why does she have this?  As someone who has been opposed to this compensation buff since the beginning, I still don't understand why this unnecessary and random buff was tacked onto her kit other than to make her look more flashy.  The Q speed does. Not. Make. Sense.  

What do people complain about the most when they talk about Ahri?  I mostly see complaints about mobility, yet that isn't what's being addressed.  
Now I see that her Charm can't stop dashes anymore...yes, because how dare the player time their skillshots to hit you as you dash forward rewarding them for reacting fast enough...  All the while, she's still running around the mid lane like a Kenyan senselessly throwing out random orbs to run away from ganks.  _That_ is the real issue.


The kiss of death mechanic was arguably the best thing that ever happened to her since it matched her theme perfectly and rewarded people for being good with her.  Why not get rid of the movespeed she has for no reason, and give back the percent damage amp on her charm?  DFG isn't in the game anymore, and  the double amplification is gone - reward the player for hitting their skillshots and punish them for mindless spamming. 

Will this change be an automatic fix?  Of course not, her kit would still need to be adjusted, but extraneous mobility is what Riot should be looking at first and foremost, not the utility of well-timed skillshots.

replies.body: So riot doesn't want to see Ahri killing people with WR so they lower the range of both spells to make it harder for her to get off raw damage because they want to see how well Ahri can land her skillshot right? But when Ahri does so they Increase the mana cost of Q to see her land her other. So Ahri focuses on hitting E all the while inturrpting people by landing it, then riot goes about nerfing the ability charm has to inturrpt various ults and now dashes. It's as if riot doesn't want Ahri to play for her skillshots. It's pretty unsettling as a main. No DFG, No compensation, No Charm amp, Lower WR ranges, Q mama cost up, passive heal nerfed and now Charm doesn't inturrpt certain abilities. Like it or not Ahri is another champion amongst 100s of champions and she just gets nerf after Nerf no matter how you play her. Honestly It's a bunch of bs, when it comes to patch note changes Ahri single handedly has the highest changes out of every champion in the game. Sad. When so many other champions who sit at the top of Winrate's who's kit is absolutely broken and have not even a comparable patch note history like Ahri does. So many champions who need balance but all the community and riot focus on is nerfing Ahri. And yet half the league champions still run rampant in terms that they are no where near balanced and are over powered but go unnoticed because??

Riot for some reason has really started to hate Ahri's charm ever since Morello left. This nerf a lot like the last one only punishes experienced Ahri players that could consistently land charm, in this case against some one mid dash. No body that doesn't play Ahri isn't even going to notice this nerf. 

I'm just going to take a wild stab in the dark and assume there is  a reason in season 4 when she was most charm reliant that she was never nerfed, infact she was buffed. It seems like taking everything away from charm while making the rest of her kit easy isn't exactly good for balance. In both season 3 and 5 she had to receive nerfs because of people abusing the low skill floor, something Riot seems hell bent on preserving.
All this does is buff the league of mobility
Which is an enormous problem in and of itself.

I wouldnt say its an enourmous problem. I would say that towers need some sort of buff becauses the mobile champions are too good at diving in and out. And immobile champions needs something. Idk what. They need spells and autos with shorter animations for sure.

What I want to know is: what internal politics lead to some champions getting compensation for their nerfs and others just get that weird pattern of nerfs that dont accomplish anything, and then get the one huge nerf they've had coming without any reversions of the ineffective nerfs. Why some champions get treated fairly, others get nerfed gently with compensations, and others just get wrecked.

Rito just plays blatant favorites.  Certain champs like Lee Sin will always be a competitive pick, or close to it because Rito will never give them a meaningful nerf.  Meanwhile other champs can be sitting at the bottom of trash and still take a nerf to the knee completely out of left field.  It's been typical Rito behavior for years and it should be expected by now.

http://i.imgur.com/yygJB7X.png
[Yeah, Lee Sin is _soooo_ good right now.](http://champion.gg/champion/LeeSin) Absolutely Riot's favorite, definitely needs nerfs. Totally isn't mediocre at best right now.

[Even in competetive play he's only been picked six times and then still he was only on the winning side in two of those games.](http://lol.gamepedia.com/2016_NA_LCS/Spring_Split/Champion_Statistics) He's never even banned.

----

I agree otherwise though. There's definitely champs that need some buffing that Riot doesn't seem to care about.
He needs a rework because even a bad Lee is overbearing and makes you feel helpless.
This. Some other favorites _might_ be: Shaco, Lux, Xin/Yi, Rengar, Trist, Blitzcrank who is unhealthilly reliant on his Q, Zed, Yas, and Ammumu. Idk really much about this topic, but yeah.

On the other hand, this ought to fix the bug where she can charm Sion, Malphite, and Vi out of their "unstoppable" ults. Maybe this was the only way they could see to fix that bug what with all of the spaghetti.
They already did. In Season 5.

What does it do exactly? Tbh, I don't understand why this nerf provokes such a high reaction. People are still CC'ed and unable to hurt you for the same duration, they just won't be at the exact same place as before. Did I miss something? I don't really play mid, so I don't know...

So picture this: your ahri and your up against a graves jungle. you catch him in the jungle and he goes to e over the wall. you hit him, but because of this change, he still goes over and you have to either use your ult, or he gets away. now, she doesnt need to use her ult. why should she be punished for hitting her spells?

So I repeat, I don't play mid or Ahri, so this is an honest question. But is this really a plausible scenario? Won't you hit your Charm before he uses his dash at all or after he has passed the wall anyway, even with the Live version?

(Side note: she is not "punished for hitting her spell", even with the PBE version. It's still better if she hits her Charm than if she does not. But it's just some small nit-picking about your phrasing, I got what you meant.)

If leblanc uses QW and ahri charmed as the dash was happening, ahri would take no damage from W. Now, ahri will take damage from the W regardless of whether the charm is hit or not. It makes that lane infinitely harder.

Long story short:

1. It really ruins some matchups ({{champion:7}} is a prime example)
2. Yes that is a plausible situation with the amount of dashes in the game. Provided the enemy has time to activate their dash during the travel time of your charm (it's quite slow) they will now be guaranteed to get to wherever they were dashing towards (making {{champion:236}} & {{champion:104}} players really happy, not to mention {{champion:18}} who will now get away pretty much 100% of the time independently of charm)
3. It weakens the ability much more than one might think seeing as landing it on a target while they are in a dash compared to when they are not is now a bad choice (removing cool shit like midair charming someone who's jumping to safety since this will just waste the duration of charm on their jump)

And for those of us who love to play her it will be really sad to see her go from having no truly bad matchups to having a fair few (not every matchup is good but with charm to stop dashes even the hardest matchups felt somewhat like a skill matchup)

I find it funny that riot around s4 wanted ahri's Q be hard to hit and rely on hitting E to be more rewarding.

All the MS buff did was make it incredibly easy to hit both sides of Q which they originally hated
I don't play Ahri, but this change seems retarded. Even if Ahri is a little bit to tough atm, it's not the way to nerf the champion, it only shows how lazy Riot is to fiind a real solution.

While I didn't get much time with Pre S5 Ahri and DFG/E Amp, I vastly prefer this Ahri to it. Regardless this will make hard match ups even harder (Such as Diana, LB, Akali), while doing nothing to easier match ups. This is not the way to nerf Ahri, but it will go through regardless since it isn't consistent with other CC
Charm isn't supposed to be consistent with other CC, it's _supposed_ to be unique. It might as well be a taunt now :^(

This nerf is so minuscule id be crying tears of joy if a champion i mained was strong and this is how they "stopped" it..

Assassin Ahri actually doesn't even exit anymore. She can't even 50/0 someone in one spell rotation if not fed. Her full ult takes too long for assassin type of game play.
And that's because of the "Rework" that turned her from an Assassin Mage to a damn Kite Mage.
I'm pretty sure once this change goes through, there'd be almost no good reason to pick Ahri lol.  There'd be almost no point in ever using charm, and over half the champion roster will dumpster her.

100% agree this nerf is completely ridiculous. this is a nerf to skilled outplay. this was her main way of countering dive, by holding onto her charm and timing it to hit them mid dash. with this nerf they are removing an option for her kit entirely. this is a huge buff for champs that already counter her like {{champion:84}} {{champion:131}} {{champion:7}} {{champion:64}} {{champion:78}} as well as many others. i'm not an ahri main btw my main mids are Diana and syndra. this is just taking us further down the path to "league of counter picks". she might be too strong(though i don'personally have a problem with her), but you wanna nerf her nerf the Q movespeed. i don't think it should be removed entirely though, just made to where you only get move speed on champion hits. this would also be a cool thematic thing since you could say she is taking their life energy like she does in her lore. but what do you expect from the guys who released {{item:3147}} ,and xin buffs despite literally everyone telling them not too.
That charm nerf is dumb... They should have just nerfed the most abusive parts of her safe kit, not the reward for a risky/reactive play.
Mobility is, apparently, a strength on Ahri they want to preserve.

This is to make Charm consistent with other crowd control. It might be a small nerf, but it's to make it so Ahri has to deal with the same type of engage other champions have to. While this might not be needed balance wise or nerf wise, this IS needed to make it consistent with every other CC in the game.

Its better to balance a champion when at least the mechanics are consistent with other similar mechanics of other champions than to balance them around having something special. I do believe this is why almost everyone hates {{champion:92}} actually.
Well every CC except threshes flay, which If i remember correct still cancels every dash that doesn't make someone immune to CC.
Every knockup/knockback does.
Flay is a knockback. (aka a displacement that immediately affects a position). Of course it stops dashes, just like Janna (q?), Trist ult, or Yasou third Q.
I didn't know Flay was a knock back since it can be used to pull people towards him.
It knocks people in the direction it is aimed. This isn't always away from Thresh.

Seems they would rather remove the skill of the champion then something stupid like the MS buff on Q. Nothing is more satisfying then stopping an LB W and Diana Ult. It's counter play and that's what makes league enjoyable and increases the skill cap of the champion.

This honestly does not feel much like a nerf..the cc still happens, but the opponent also finishes their dash. I can see this being either good or bad depending on the case itself. In most cases however, it is bad.

The main reason I don't like this is because I felt like this gave the "charm" effect more flavor as opposed to being a reverse fear. as far as balance goes however, I do feel like she needs some slight nerfs, and should be taken from elsewhere in the kit. Maybe take away the randomly tacked-on q movement speed boost..
try playing ahri in certain matchups, and you'll see how hard this actually is

As one of league's top kiting mages and safest laners, the "matchup" game can essentially be avoided anyways.

Something this circumstancial has visible, albeit overall minor impact.
